title: 14 teams that will make the NFL playoffs -- and six that will be left out: Barnwell’s preseason picks
content: Which teams from last season's playoffs will return? Who will be the surprises in the 14-team bracket? And who will win the Super Bowl?

title: Bold predictions, strengths and concerns for all 32 teams
content: Here's everything you need to know ahead of the NFL regular season, including how teams rank before Week 1.

title: Dominant Sinner motors back into US Open semis
content: Defending champion Jannik Sinner needed just two hours to defeat Lorenzo Musetti 6-1, 6-4, 6-2 at the US Open and advance to his fifth straight Grand Slam semifinal.

title: Reports: Koch family to buy 10% stake in Giants
content: The Koch family has agreed to purchase a 10% stake in the New York Giants, as first reported by Bloomberg on Wednesday.

title: 49ers add $3M in incentives to WR Jennings' deal
content: The 49ers and Jauan Jennings have agreed to add $3 million in play-time incentives to his contract for this season.

title: Sky's Reese: Didn't mean to put down teammates
content: Angel Reese said Wednesday night she apologized to her Sky teammates for remarks she made to the Chicago Tribune.

title: FSU player was shot in back of head, father says
content: Florida State's Ethan Pritchard was shot in the back of the head Sunday night, his father said, and remains in stable condition at Tallahassee Memorial Hospital.

title: Sources: NBA ASG to have 2 U.S. teams, 1 World
content: The 2026 NBA All-Star Game will likely be a round-robin tournament consisting of three eight-player teams -- two USA teams and one World team -- sources told ESPN.

title: Meyers says Raiders future unclear amid talks
content: Raiders receiver Jakobi Meyers, who is in the final year of his deal, is unsure if a new contract will get done with the organizatiion: "We're gonna see how it plays out."

title: Report: Clippers skirted cap with Kawhi payment
content: The Clippers reportedly have been accused of circumventing the NBA's salary cap by paying $28 million to Kawhi Leonard for a "no-show job."

title: 🤔 The 11 biggest fantasy questions for Week 1
content: How the Bears' offense will look, TreVeyon Henderson's role and Travis Hunter's snap count are among the curiosities.

title: The ultimate upset: How Amanda Anisimova beat Iga Swiatek
content: Fewer than two months ago, Swiatek bested Anisimova in the Wimbledon final 6-0, 6-0. On Wednesday, Ansimova got her revenge.

title: The Life of a (halftime) Showgirl? Roger Goodell says Taylor Swift a 'maybe' for Super Bowl LX
content: The pop superstar, who is engaged to Travis Kelce, could serve as the headliner for the Super Bowl LX halftime show.

title: How the relationship between Parsons and the Cowboys broke down
content: The disputed nature of a March meeting with Jerry Jones charted a course for Micah Parsons' exit from Dallas.

title: Eagles' A.J. Brown wants more for himself, and for others
content: All indications point to Brown being "hungrier than ever," as the Eagles begin to defend their title.

title: Matchup rankings: Chase Brown, Emeka Egbuka stand out in Week 1
content: Here are the most and least favorable matchups at quarterback, running back, wide receiver and tight end.

title: WNBA Power Rankings: Best-case scenarios for all 13 teams to end the season
content: From home-court advantage in the first round to awards, here's what each team is playing for down the stretch.

title: LeBron, Kobe and the scars that led to Redeem Team gold in 2008
content: Following a disappointing bronze medal in the 2004 Olympics, the 2008 Team USA roster was out for redemption.

title: USMNT transfer grades: Analyzing every American move in the summer window
content: A bunch of USMNT players have been on the move. Let's grade them all, from Matt Turner to Gio Reyna and everyone in between ahead of the 2026 World Cup.

title: From walk-offs to blowouts to ... did that really just happen?! All of the ways the Rockies have lost games in 2025
content: Colorado has lost games in practically every way imaginable this season. We look back on how the team reached 100 losses.

title: Judging the MLB trade deadline -- one month later
content: A look at where all 30 teams stand ahead of the final stretch -- and if their deadline deals have actually paid off.

title: Can you import an entire offense? OU hopes so with John Mateer, Ben Arbuckle
content: OU is the latest team to bring in a new playcaller and QB to boost offense. The Sooners need big things from Mateer and Arbuckle.

title: AP Week 1 poll reaction: What's next for each Top 25 team
content: College football came back in a big way this past weekend, with high-profile matchups and some surprise scores. Now it's time to look forward for the country's best teams.

title: Latest rosters for 90+ men's college basketball teams: Transfers, recruits, more
content: Players leaving. Players joining. We're updating key rosters as players arrive on campus for the 2025-26 season.

title: Five months from Olympics, here's what you should know about Team USA men's hockey
content: Will Matthew Tkachuk be healthy enough to play? Can Tage Thompson crack the lineup? We look at some of the biggest topics coming out of the recent orientation camp.

title: WSL preview: Chelsea, City, Arsenal to fight for title? Liverpool, Spurs in danger?
content: Chelsea have won the last six WSL titles, but will they focus on UWCL glory? How will promoted London City do? And could Liverpool, Spurs drop down?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United still open to Onana exit
content: Manchester United's André Onana could still leave the club in the next few weeks. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Italian Grand Prix at Monza: All the times, stats and facts to know
content: Formula 1 heads to Monza, the Temple of Speed and home of Ferrari for round 16 of the 2025 season. Find out the stats, session times and latest news.

title: Weekly pickups: Jonah Tong, Payton Tolle lead fantasy playoff picks
content: The players you should claim off the waiver wire, including some pitchers to help you in the fantasy playoffs.

title: Flood Alert In Delhi, Yamuna Above Danger Mark, Relief Camps Submerged
content: Relief camps in low-lying areas of Delhi, including those near Mayur Vihar Phase-I, were inundated on Thursday as the Yamuna River swelled dangerously above the danger mark following incessant rainfall.

title: GST Revamp: What's Cheaper, Costlier? See Full List Here
content: New GST rates: The Goods and Services Tax (GST) Council on Wednesday approved a complete overhaul of India's tax consumption tax since its launch in 2017.

title: Madhya Pradesh: Minor Rape Survivor Sent To Accused's Home, Assaulted Again
content: A 15-year-old rape survivor from Madhya Pradesh's Panna district was allegedly sent by the local Child Welfare Committee (CWC) to the home of her accused, where she was subjected to further sexual assaults.

title: Markets Cheer Centre's GST Bonanza, Sensex Rises Nearly 700 Points
content: The Indian stock market on Thursday opened in the green, a day after the Union government approved a complete overhaul of the Goods and Services Tax (GST) system.

title: Salted Or Caramel? GST Council Clears Confusion Over Popcorn Taxes
content: The long-running debate over how popcorn should be taxed under the Goods and Services Tax (GST) has finally been settled.

title: Donor Heart Arrives From Chandigarh To Delhi In Under 2 Hours Via Green Corridor
content: In a remarkable feat of medical expertise and coordination, doctors at a private hospital in Delhi successfully performed a life-saving heart transplant surgery on a 39-year-old man from Meerut.

title: "Big Diwali Gift": Businessman Harsh Goenka On GST Rates Revision
content: Industrialist Harsh Goenka has called the recent Centre's decision to slash and rationalise Goods and Services Tax (GST) rates under the NextGen GST framework a "big Diwali gift" for every Indian.

title: The Algebra Of Alliances: Bihar's Political Chessboard In 2025
content: In the hot and humid heartland of Bihar, shaped like a griddle, where the Ganges flows as both lifeblood and metaphor, the stage is set for a political drama that is as much about loyalty as it is about ambition.

title: Only 5% And 18% GST Slabs From September 22. 40% For Super Luxury Items
content: The complicated GST slabs that gave headaches to small traders after the flagship tax overhaul came into effect eight years ago, was cleaned up by the government today, leaving only two slabs -- 5 and 18 per cent.

title: Putin Calls Unipolar World "Unfair", Backs Multipolar Order Without "Hegemons"
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Wednesday advocated for the end of a "unipolar world", emphasising a multipolar global order where all nations are equal without any "hegemons" dominating politics or security.

title: Why No Action Against Russia? Trump Snaps At Reporter With "India" Reply
content: US President Donald Trump on Wednesday said he put secondary sanctions on India for buying Russian oil and indicated that he hasn't done "phase two yet or phase three."

title: UP Man Assaulted By Wife, Family Members Over Samosas; Case Filed
content: An FIR on charges of attempt to murder was on Wednesday registered after a man was allegedly beaten up by his wife and her relatives during a village panchayat convened over a trivial dispute of his failure to bring samosas.

title: Delhi, Haryana Chief Ministers Hold Talks As Drain Breach Floods Villages
content: A breach in the Mungeshpur drain near Bahadurgarh in Haryana's Jhajjar district has flooded parts of the DelhiHaryana border, forcing the evacuation of nearly 2,000 people and triggering overnight repair and relief efforts.

title: "Welcome But Too Late": Congress's P Chidambaram On GST Reforms
content: Senior Congress leader and Rajya Sabha MP P Chidambaram has welcomed the Centre's recent GST rationalisation and rate cuts but criticised the move as being "8 years too late".

title: Google Must Pay $425 Million In Class Action Over Privacy, Rules Court
content: A federal jury determined on Wednesday that Alphabet's Google must pay $425 million in a class action lawsuit that accused it of continuing to collect data for millions of users who had switched off a tracking feature in their Google account.

title: Maharashtra To Amend Laws For Longer Private Sector Work Hours
content: The Maharashtra cabinet on Wednesday gave its approval to amend laws that will allow increasing the maximum daily working hours for private sector employees from the present nine to 10 hours.

title: Trump Says China Should Have Mentioned US During "Beautiful Ceremony"
content: President Donald Trump said on Wednesday that China's "beautiful ceremony" marking the end of World War Two should have highlighted the role that the U.S. played in Japan's defeat.

title: US Court Reverses Trump's Cuts Of Billions Of Dollars To Harvard
content: A federal judge in Boston on Wednesday ordered the reversal of the Trump administration's cuts to more than $2.6 billion in funding research grants for Harvard University.

title: "Historic Decision": Amit Shah, Rajnath Singh Laud PM Modi For GST Reforms
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah lauded Prime Minister Narendra Modi for the GST reforms and called it a "historic decision" to cut tax rates.

title: 15 Killed, 18 Injured After Streetcar Derails In Lisbon
content: An electric streetcar that is one of Lisbon's landmarks and a big draw for tourists derailed Wednesday, killing 15 people and injuring 18 others, emergency services said.

title: From paneer to paratha, Centre explains tweaks in GST rates
content: The GST Council has approved significant rate cuts across various sectors, effective September 22nd, providing relief to consumers and farmers. Daily-use items like hair oil, shampoo, and toothpaste will now attract a reduced 5% GST, while health and life insurance are entirely exempt.

title: US Open 2025: History in the making? Bhambri closer to 'dream' final
content: Yuki Bhambri and Michael Venus have advanced to the US Open 2025 men's doubles semifinals, defeating Nikola Mektic and Rajeev Ram. Bhambri, India's top-ranked doubles player, achieves his first Grand Slam semifinal. He aims to be the first Indian champion at the US Open since 2015, while other Indian pairs faced early exits.

title: Delhi floods: Yamuna swallows homes inch by inch
content: Torrential floods, triggered by a drain breach near the Delhi-Haryana border, submerged Jharoda Kalan and parts of Gitanjali Colony, displacing thousands. Mungeshpur was particularly affected, with residents forced to flee their homes as water levels rose rapidly. Rescue operations were initiated, and a municipal school was converted into a relief camp.

title: Trump snaps at Putin question: US prez blasts reporter; cites 'India' to justify stance
content: President Trump defended his administration's actions against Russia, citing secondary sanctions on India as a significant measure costing Russia "hundreds of billions of dollars." He rebuked a Polish reporter questioning the lack of punitive actions against Putin, highlighting India's oil purchases and hinting at further sanctions. Trump also suggested the reporter should seek new employment due to their perceived lack of understanding.

title: Trump tariffs on digital taxes? Meta CEO raises concerns; semiconductors at risk
content: Donald Trump has threatened tariffs on nations imposing digital taxes, following concerns raised by Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg about European regulatory overreach. Trump, who once called Zuckerberg a 'criminal,' seems to have mended fences, evident from recent White House meetings and Meta's support for Trump's inauguration.

title: GST rate cuts bonanza! What is cheaper and dearer? Check full list of items
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced significant GST rate cuts, effective September 22, bringing relief to the common man. Daily use items like hair oil, soaps, and toothpaste now fall under the 5% tax bracket. Several items, including ultra-high temperature milk and paneer, face zero tax. Air conditioners, TVs, and small cars are now taxed at 18%.

title: Indian on world trip slams UK police after bike theft, says he misses Mumbai Police
content: An Indian blogger, Yogesh Alekari, on a global motorbike tour, criticized British police after his bike was stolen in Nottingham. The theft occurred in a paid parking area at Wollaton Park, with his passport and belongings onboard.

title: Watching IPL, cricket gets costlier: How GST rate changes impacts sports
content: Cricket enthusiasts will face steeper prices for IPL tickets as the government has increased GST rates from 28% to 40%, categorising IPL viewing as a luxury activity alongside casinos. This significant hike means a Rs 1,000 ticket now costs Rs 1,400, up from Rs 1,280, impacting fans across India.

title: Amazon's cost-cutting rule: New phone policy; staff must report personal usage
content: Amazon is now requiring employees to meticulously report the percentage of work-related usage on their company-issued phones. This is to adjust their $50 monthly reimbursements proportionally, based on personal use. This phone monitoring is part of CEO Andy Jassy's "hardcore culture reset" and cost-cutting measures, leading to employee frustration and anxiety about job security.

title: US immigrant students priced out as states end tuition support
content: Thousands of immigrant students across the US are being forced to delay or abandon university as several states revoke access to in-state tuition. The change, driven by shifting immigration policies under President Trump, has led to increased education costs and limited opportunities for students without legal status. Many are turning to online study or entering low-wage work. Legal challenges and federal investigations are also targeting institutions offering tuition support to undocumented students.

title: 'US will suffer so greatly': Trump warns of 'unbelievably poor' America
content: President Trump warned of dire economic consequences if the Supreme Court doesn't overturn a ruling against his tariffs, suggesting the US could become "unbelievably poor." He claimed trade deals with the EU, Japan, and South Korea might be unwound. Experts believe Trump's statements aim to pressure the Supreme Court by highlighting potential economic chaos.

title: ‘A bet on myself’: Youngest female billionaire on why she left college early
content: Lucy Guo, Forbes' youngest self-made billionaire, attributes her entrepreneurial drive to her frugal upbringing. Despite disappointing her immigrant parents by dropping out of Carnegie Mellon, she pursued the Thiel Fellowship. Guo's early hustles, from playground trading to selling virtual items and creating internet tools, laid the foundation for her success in the tech world.

title: Haider Ali exonerated: Pak cricketer cleared of rape charges in UK
content: Pakistani cricketer Haider Ali has been cleared of rape charges in the UK after a thorough investigation by Greater Manchester Police and the Crown Prosecution Service found insufficient evidence. The case, initiated by a British-Pakistani woman's allegations, was weakened by evidence suggesting a consensual meeting and a delayed complaint.

title: ‘Rent, rules & reality’: US visa crackdown hits Indian students hard
content: Stricter visa enforcement and dwindling job opportunities are creating significant hardships for Indian students in the US. Many are facing financial strain due to revoked visas, workplace inspections, and limited work hours, forcing them to cut expenses drastically and seek family support.

title: UMich expands reporting, anti-discrimination rules: Can accountability reach all?
content: The University of Michigan has expanded mandatory misconduct reporting duties to nearly all non-confidential employees and introduced an interim anti-discrimination policy for students. The changes, fulfilling federal oversight requirements, aim to strengthen accountability and trust across campus.

title: Manju Sharma resigns from RPSC over ‘Rajasthan HC remarks’ on SI exam leak
content: Manju Sharma has resigned from the Rajasthan Public Service Commission (RPSC) following criticism from the Rajasthan High Court regarding the 2021 Sub-Inspector Recruitment Exam. Sharma cited damage to her reputation and the commission's dignity due to the controversy. Her resignation letter has been sent to the governor, and a copy was received by the RPSC.

title: Car, bikes GST new slabs explained: Winners, losers, effective date etc
content: The GST Council has approved a significant overhaul of automobile taxation, set to take effect on September 22, 2025. Small cars, entry-level motorcycles, and commercial vehicles will see reduced GST rates, while larger cars and high-end motorcycles will face increased taxes. This restructuring aims to simplify tax slabs and impact vehicle pricing across the country.

title: Congress 'welcomes' GST rate cuts but calls decision '8 years too late'
content: Congress has criticized the Centre's recent GST cuts as belated, arguing the original tax design was flawed. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced the rate reductions, effective September 22, shifting many items to the 5% and 18% slabs, with some items now at 0% and others at a 40% 'sin tax' rate.

title: Record alert! Zimbabwe opener breaks unique T20I milestone of Faf & Babar
content: Brian Bennett's impressive 81, studded with 12 boundaries, set a record for the highest T20I score by a full ICC member without a six, powering Zimbabwe to 175-7. However, Sri Lanka chased down the target, fueled by Pathum Nissanka's 55 and Kamindu Mendis's explosive 41*, securing a four-wicket victory despite Bennett's batting feat.

title: 'Gukesh will lose his title': Uzbek GM's latest comment sparks controversy - Watch
content: Nodirbek Abdusattorov ignited a pre-tournament buzz by confidently predicting D Gukesh's title loss, adding intrigue to the FIDE Grand Swiss 2025. While Gukesh aims to test himself in the Swiss format despite already securing his title match spot, Abdusattorov's remark intensifies the competition, especially with Candidates Tournament qualification at stake for many participants.

title: Stock market: Nifty50 opens above 24,850; Sensex rallies over 500 points on GST rate cuts
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Thursday, rallying strongly on the back of sweeping GST rate cuts announced by FM Nirmala Sitharaman.

title: Lunar eclipse 2025: Why is it called a Blood Moon? When & where to watch in India
content: Coffee raves are now a social trend in Indian cities. Cafes are turning into daytime dance floors. This culture is gaining popularity in Mumbai, Bengaluru, and other cities. These events feature electronic music, coffee, and a vibrant community. DJ Tanishq is spearheading this trend with his 'More Coffee More Rave' tour.

title: Haryana’s most wanted gangster Mainpal Badli who opened disco in Cambodia deported
content: Mainpal Badli, Haryana's most wanted gangster, was recaptured after seven years on the run following a parole jump. He had been living in Cambodia as a disco owner under a false identity, having fled India with a fake passport and a large sum of cash.

title: Harvard wins as court reverses Trump’s $2.6B research funding freeze
content: A United States judge has directed the Trump administration to reinstate billions in research funds to Harvard University. The court found the funding cuts were politically motivated. The administration froze the funds, citing concerns about antisemitism. Harvard sued, arguing the move jeopardized vital research. The judge ruled the action violated constitutional rights. The administration plans to appeal.

title: 'Protect kids not guns': JD Vance heckled outside Minneapolis church
content: Vice President JD Vance visited Annunciation Catholic Church in Minneapolis to pay tribute to the victims of a recent mass shooting. The visit was met with protests criticizing gun violence, while Vance met with grieving families inside the church. He pledged to advocate for policies addressing the root causes of such tragedies, emphasizing the need to focus on the lives lost.

title: Yamuna at 3rd highest level in 63 years, several areas flooded
content: Heavy discharge from Hathnikund barrage caused the Yamuna River to swell, crossing the 207-meter mark in Delhi and displacing around 12,000 people. The water level is expected to rise further, approaching the historic 1978 flood levels.

title: Top shares to buy: Stock recommendations for today- check list
content: Top stock market recommendations: Nuvama Professional Clients Group's Aakash K Hindocha recommends buying Dabur, Bajaj Auto, and Amara Raja Energy & Mobility. Nifty is expected to move towards 24900/25050, supported at 24500, while Bank Nifty, hovering near a 3.5-month low, may see a short covering rally above 54100.

title: Kim Jong's secret lavatory on Beijing trip— Why aides wipe rooms post meetings
content: Kim Jong Un's recent trip to China involved extraordinary measures to safeguard his DNA and health information. He traveled with a private toilet on his armored train, a precaution taken on previous international trips. After his meeting with Vladimir Putin, aides meticulously cleaned the space, removing items and wiping surfaces to eliminate any traces of the leader's DNA.

title: Check this out, mate! 200 children in Gujarat village set eye on Grandmasters 's title
content: In a Gujarat village, a dilapidated school has become a breeding ground for chess prodigies. Sandip Upadhyay, a dedicated teacher, uses his own funds and initiative to train underprivileged children, nurturing their chess ambitions.

title: 'Don't even remember family': Pak cricketer on missing Babar, Rizwan
content: Faheem Ashraf cleverly addressed Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan's absence after Pakistan's loss to Afghanistan in the tri-series. He emphasized the team's focus on winning, even amidst missing key players. Both Babar and Rizwan were excluded due to recent poor T20I performances, while Pakistan prepares to face UAE in their next match.

title: Kawhi Leonard name dragged into no-show endorsement scam
content: Kawhi Leonard, who joined the Clippers in 2019, is now linked to a fraudulent tree-planting company, Aspiration, allegedly funded by Steve Ballmer. Leonard reportedly signed a $28 million "no-show job" endorsement deal with Aspiration through KL2 Aspire LLC. The Clippers deny circumventing the salary cap, while Aspiration is under U.S. government investigation.

title: 'Nothing is working': Matthew Stafford’s wife exhausted over parenting challenges
content: Kelly Stafford, wife of Rams quarterback Matthew Stafford, is candidly navigating the challenges of raising four daughters. She revealed struggles with one daughter's disrespectful behavior towards coaches and emotional outbursts. Despite parenting exhaustion and Matthew's demanding NFL schedule, Kelly balances family life, celebrating milestones like back-to-school while supporting her husband's preseason preparations for the upcoming 2025 season.

title: Jack Brady skips Gisele visit for special outing with mom Bridget Moynahan
content: Bridget Moynahan and her son Jack were spotted at the US Open, continuing their tradition at Arthur Ashe Stadium. This appearance followed Tom Brady's heartfelt social media tribute to Jack on his 18th birthday, highlighting their strong father-son bond. Despite Brady and Moynahan's past relationship, they maintain a respectful co-parenting dynamic, prioritizing their children's well-being.

title: Gross savings, less taxing; GST rejig expected to revive demand; FMCG packs to get cheaper
content: Ahead of the festive season, the GST cut on household staples and medicines is set to boost consumption and ease prices. Companies anticipate increased demand for various products, with tax cut benefits passed on through price reductions or increased grammage. This move is expected to energize consumer sentiment, particularly in rural areas, and stimulate growth in the FMCG sector.

title: Guv's absolute discretion on bills means negating people's will: Bengal in SC
content: West Bengal has cautioned that granting governors the power to decide the fate of bills would undermine states' legislative functions. The Supreme Court's timeline for governors and the President would expedite the process of turning people's will into laws. The Constitution does not assign governors a dominating position in state legislative or executive functions, according to the TMC government.

title: Massive revelation! 'I broke every rule in the book,' says Lalit Modi
content: Lalit Modi, the former IPL chairman, admitted to intentionally violating broadcasting regulations during the inaugural IPL match in 2008 to maximize viewership, overriding Sony's exclusive rights. Despite potential legal repercussions, Modi prioritized widespread access to ensure the tournament's success. This decision later led to contract disputes, investigations, and legal proceedings against Modi regarding alleged favoritism towards World Sports Group.

title: Bihar jail turns into a wedding venue for rape accused, survivor
content: In a rare turn of events, a jail in Madhubani, Bihar, became the venue for a wedding between an inmate and his widowed sister-in-law. The accused, facing charges of sexual exploitation, married the woman following a Patna High Court directive. The court granted bail on the condition that the marriage be verified.

title: Gretzky and Canada’s crisis: From hero to fading icon - who defines hockey now?
content: Wayne Gretzky, once the undisputed symbol of Canadian hockey, is now being re-evaluated as the sport evolves. While his legacy remains significant, the rise of international stars and Canada's changing role in the global game have sparked an identity crisis. Canadians are urged to embrace a future where their hockey identity extends beyond a single figure.

title: Delhi rains: SpiceJet issues advisory; urges passengers to check flight status
content: SpiceJet issued a travel advisory due to heavy rains disrupting flight operations in Delhi, warning passengers of potential delays and cancellations. The India Meteorological Department forecasts continued rain and thunderstorms. Rising water levels in the Yamuna River prompted evacuations from low-lying areas, with authorities establishing relief camps and deploying disaster response teams.

title: 'Nobody knows who I am': Josh Allen on being overshadowed by wife Hailee Steinfeld
content: Josh Allen is navigating a new chapter, balancing his NFL career with supporting his wife, Hailee Steinfeld, a global celebrity. Allen humorously notes the shift in attention during international events like fashion weeks, where Steinfeld's fame takes center stage. He expresses admiration and pride for her accomplishments as they both pursue major milestones in their respective careers.

title: Congress terms GST overhaul 'GST 1.5'; says wait for 'true GST 2.0' continues
content: Jairam Ramesh said that a key demand of the states, the extension of compensation for another five years to fully protect their revenues, remains unaddressed

title: DC inspects rain-hit areas in Kalaburagi district of Karnataka
content: She also inspected the water purification plant on Jewargi Road in Shahabad town, and directed officials to ensure supply of safe drinking water

title: What began as classifieds, Locanto and Skokka are now hotspots for organised prostitution, cyber frauds
content: Investigators say fraudsters exploit technical loopholes and international servers to stay ahead of enforcement

title: India rains LIVE: Yamuna swells past 207 metres in Delhi; Centre deploys inter-ministerial team to assess Jammu flood damage
content: In Punjab, rescue and relief operations are underway on a war footing as the State faces its worst deluge since 1988

title: Should reservations exceed the 50% cap? | Explained
content: What do Articles 15 and 16 of the Constitution guarantee? How are formal and substantive equality different? Are reservations an exception to the idea of equality of opportunity or a continuation? Are reservation benefits concentrated within specific sub-castes in OBCs, SCs and STs?

title: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu calls for strengthening the local bodies financially
content: Suggesting the local bodies to pursue revenue-generation opportunities, while ensuring accountability in fund utilisation, the Chief Minister asks officials to identify the local bodies with low per capita income so that targeted support can be extended to them

title: Chandrababu Naidu pushes for more homestays, tent houses to boost tourism in Andhra Pradesh
content: The Chief Minister calls for the participation of NRIs to achieve targets of creating 10,000 new hotel rooms by March 2026 and 50,000 rooms by 2029

title: Sewage treatment plant proposed to address wastewater flowing through Coimbatore International Airport
content: The untreated sewage has led to foul odour spreading across the airport and nearby residential areas, a matter that has been repeatedly raised with civic officials.

title: Daily working hours allowed to go up from 9 to 10 hours in Maharashtra’s private sector as State cabinet plans to amend laws
content: The move is aimed at attracting investments, generating employment and safeguarding workers' rights, an official statement said

title: Chandrababu Naidu denounces YSRCP’s ‘fake campaign’ on fertilizer supply, warns of stern action
content: The State has 94,892 MT of urea available as on September 3 and that the Central government has allotted an additional 53,000 MT, which will reach in about 10 days, the Chief Minister asserts; he also advises farmers to keep away from politics

title: SIT files B Report in gang rape case against Munirathna
content: The investigation found no contact between the complainant and the MLA and found no evidence to substantiate the allegations made, leading the police to file a B report in the case

title: Dalit Subbiah: A revolutionary musician’s life celebrated in award-winning Tamil documentary at IDSFFK
content: A film about a seemingly docile revolutionary turns quickly into a the celebration of a superstar in Dalit Subbiah — Voice of the Rebels, the film that won the best long doc at IDSFFK

title: Fake SHGs siphoned off ₹56 crore during 2019-24, says 20-Point programme chief Lanka Dinakar
content: Stating that cases have been filed against those responsible, he says biometric authentication linked to Aadhaar has been introduced to prevent duplicate membership and fake groups

title: TCS Delivery Centre in Vizag likely to start operations in September
content: A deadline of September 20 has been set to complete all infrastructure and internal works at the TCS office in Rushikonda Hill, says official

title: Rajasthan Assembly passes Bill to regulate coaching centres amid Opposition’s protest
content: Congress MLAs protested against the introduction of the Bill with “watered down” provisions and said the BJP government was playing into the hands of coaching institutes

title: Kolkata’s oldest bookshop opens a free library at its historic College Street premises
content: Dasgupta and Co. has created a public library mainly with the intention of benefiting students who can’t afford books; an online library is also on the anvil

title: U.S. firm Jaggaer opens GCC in Hyderabad, plans to ramp hiring
content: The facility has 180 employees and there are plans to raise the headcount to 500 in coming years, the firm said

title: Rift among Indian scientists as International Olympiad on Astronomy and Astrophysics bans Israel from future editions
content: More than 500 academics petitioned to suspend Israel’s official participation in the International Olympiad on Astronomy and Astrophysics, prompting a backlash from 300 Indian scientists who urged the Prime Minister to take strict action

title: Consumer Commission orders private hospital to compensate woman for post C-section complications
content: The complainants contended that what happened to Naseemunnisa was on account of negligence in administering anaesthesia

title: Six family members get life imprisonment for murder in Odisha
content: “After nearly three years, Additional Sessions Judge Bishnu Prasad Mishra convicted Anant Pujari, Siba Shankar Pujari, Chandan Pujari, Dumar Pujari and Dalimba Pujari under Sections 302 and 149 IPC. A juvenile involved in the crime was tried separately and also sentenced to life imprisonment,” said Santosh Mishra, Additional Public Prosecutor

title: Apex Manipur Naga body announces trade embargo from September 8
content: The restriction on trade and transportation of goods follows the Centre’s “indifference” to pleas against scrapping the Free Movement Regime and fencing the India-Myanmar border

title: Small cars, bikes up to 350 cc to get cheaper as GST reforms kick in
content: Almost one-third of the passenger vehicles industry will see price reduction of 8.5%; Revised GST slabs to spur demand, help in auto sales especially in the festive season

title: Reviving MGNREGS in West Bengal
content: The Centre, State, and local bodies must act now to restore this lifeline — ensuring that no worker is left behind

title: High coliform levels detected on four stretches of Periyar
content: The analysis of water samples was done as part of the CPCB’s National Water Quality Monitoring Programme

title: Infopark phase-3: GCDA to deploy dedicated team of officials for land-pooling
content: GCDA becomes first local body to act as ‘appropriate authority’; ‘300 acres to be identified based on various parameters’

title: UDF, BJP contest final voter’s list in Ernakulam
content: UDF leader alleges 142 voters from his ward were included in another; BJP claims delimitation and list preparation were faulty

title: Railway police in Ernakulam flag alarming trend of ‘hit and rob’ cases
content: Of the six major theft cases registered by the Ernakulam railway police in August, four pertained to offenders snatching mobile phones and other valuables after attacking those who travel by sitting on footboards of train

title: Notorious gangster deported from Cambodia, arrested by Haryana STF
content: Mainpal Badli, wanted in two dozen cases of murder, attempt to murder, dacoity and robbery, had jumped parole in 2018, and fled to Mauritius, then Indonesia before settling at Siem Reap in Cambodia.

title: Youth dies after pilot car in Trinamool Congress MLA’s hits motorbike
content: The Registration Certificate of the vehicle which met with the accident had expired a year ago raising questions as to how such a vehicle could be used for pilot car services.

title: Students cautioned against falling prey to drug menace
content: EAGLE emphasises need for prevention of crimes, says students will be made active part of the government’s fight against drugs, highlights parents’ role in guiding children in the right path

title: Search on for bike rider who sped past over rail platform
content: The youth reportedly rode a premium bike onto the second platform of the station and sped past the passengers

title: Police lathi-charge farmers waiting for fertilizer in Rewa as shortage problem worsens in Madhya Pradesh
content: The incident took place at Rewa’s Karahiya Mandi, where several farmers were waiting to collect tokens for fertlizer, with some alleging that they had been waiting for at least 48 hours and mismanagement on part of the administration

title: Bhutan’s PM Dasho Tshering Tobgay visits Nalanda University in Rajgir
content: He described Nalanda as a vast city of scholarship and spirituality, producing great masters and shaping Buddhist traditions that continue to flourish in Bhutan.

title: Paddy farmers to stage hunger strike in Kerala
content: Farmers under the banner of the Kole Protection Committee will stage a hunger strike at Changaramkulam near Edappal on Thursday.

title: COP-30 curtain raiser in Kolkata raises alarms for the Sundarbans delta’s severe erosion and rising sea levels
content: Activists and leaders call for global action and immediate technological and financial support to restore the ecologically sensitive delta

title: Maratha quota row: ‘Who are you to give Kunbi certificates,’ Bhujbal questions his own government
content: “This order will definitely affect the OBCs. I am in the process of taking legal consultation,” NCP leader Chhagan Bhujbal said; he also warned of a mass protest

title: ₹398 crore flyover project to ease east-west traffic congestion in Mehdipatnam
content: The flyover project in the area comes exactly 20 years after the conceptualisation of the PVNR Expressway that was completed in 2009 under a Congress government

title: Amit Shah asks Tamil Nadu BJP leaders to desist from commenting on OPS, Dhinakaran
content: The core group was asked to identify Assembly seats where the BJP might contest in alliance with the AIADMK in 2026, although no number was provided

title: Flyers without mobility issues can pay for wheelchair: DGCA
content: Proposal part of draft norms placed for stakeholder consultations ahead of Bombay High Court hearing on September 25 after the court ordered an expert committee to examine the issue of wheelchair availability at airports

title: GST Council approves two-rate tax slab effective September 22
content: Govt retains 5% and 18% slabs; reforms carried out with focus on common man, says Finance Minister; products such as soap, shampoo, toothbrushes, bicycles may cost less with inclusion in 5% slab

title: T.N. restricts provision of ‘guard of honour’ during official visits of VIPs in connection with State government functions
content: The State government has decided that these seven personages “shall only be entitled to a guard of honour during their official visit to Tamil Nadu in connection with the State government functions”

title: India, EFTA trade pact to come into force from October 1: Switzerland
content: Under the pact, India has received an investment commitment of $100 billion in 15 years from the grouping while allowing several products such as Swiss watches, chocolates and cut and polished diamonds at lower or zero duties

title: Internal reservation: Nomadic castes to continue indefinite stir
content: Federation for Social Justice for SCs seeks priority in reservation for 59 microscopic communities, including nomadic and semi-nomadic castes, which have been identified as the most backward castes among the SCs by the commission

title: Reservation roster faces criticism for ‘favouring general category’ in Karnataka
content: The new roster violates the guidelines and is against the roster announced in 2022, says Karnataka State SC/ST Government Employees Association president D. Chandrashekaraiah

title: BJP to hold meetings with partners on Bihar strategy
content: Discussions with NDA partners to be held in every Assembly seat over the next three weeks; Leaders to rally against offensive language aimed at PM’s mother

title: T.T.V. Dhinakaran exits NDA even as Amit Shah seeks to mend relations
content: Mr. Dhinakaran reiterates the AMMK had unconditionally joined the NDA during the 2024 Parliamentary elections only to ensure Narendra Modi’s return as Prime Minister for the third time

title: Centre issues guidelines to co-locate 11 lakh anganwadis on nearest school premises
content: Co-location eases transition from pre-school to primary school, aids curriculum alignment, community participation; so far, 2.9 lakh anganwadis have been co-located or mapped with schools with Class 1

title: Assam Jatiya Parishad protests extension of CAA deadline
content: The AJP termed the extension of the deadline as the “biggest crime” ever committed against Assamese people, and accused the Bharatiya Janata Party-led government of perpetuating historical injustice

title: Navarro’s ‘Brahmin’ remarks reflect utter ignorance: Suhag A. Shukla
content: Rather than basing his arguments for tariffs on logic or sound reasoning, he’s showing a preference towards sycophancy combined with racist colonial stereotypes, says HAF Executive Director

title: Supreme Court has championed the right to dignity through multiple judgments: CJI
content: The Supreme Court has intervened to declare human dignity as a ‘Constitutional value that remains inviolable, even within the confines of incarceration’, the CJI said

title: Tejashwi Yadav hits back at PM, says his remarks on mother’s insult a ‘dikhawati’
content: The RJD leader questions timing of Prime Minster’s remarks, says he was laughing when abroad but began speaking about the insult to his mother once he returned to India

title: NHRC issues notice to Punjab government over reports of stray dog seen carrying baby’s head near Patiala government hospital
content: Citing media reports, NHRC says patient attendants alleged poor sanitation, negligence, but medical superintendent says no baby missing from hospital; Punjab Chief Secy, police asked to report in two weeks

title: India killed U.S. with tariffs, now offers ‘no tariffs’: Trump
content: Donald Trump said he “understood tariffs better than any human being in the world” and with his tariffs, the other countries “were all dropping them”

title: Karnataka High Court declines to interfere with policy for compulsory use of 20% jute bags for packing sugar
content: A judge cannot assume the role of ‘super adviser’, says the court; It is for standing advisory committee to examine whether jute batching oil causes serious health hazards, it adds

title: Ramanagar sends the message of harmony, as Christians and Muslims join Ganeshotsav
content: For the last four years, along with Hindus, Christians and Muslims have been actively involving themselves in rituals during the celebrations

title: Fantasy baseball news: Tucker to sit for Cubs; Boston's Anthony leaves early
content: the fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around baseball . the los Angeles Angels will reportedly call up Caden Dana to handle tonight's road start against the Kansas City Royals .

title: Ready for Week 1, the Browns are stocked with young talent, a reshaped QB room and an energized Myles Garrett
content: shedeur Sanders' final preseason performance could doom his chances of playing in the regular season . he says he'd never wear an all-brown suit again . the decor was a nod to Garrett's love for the prehistoric animals .

title: 'He's not trying to be a celebrity': How Justin Fields differs from Aaron Rodgers
content: a week 1 win means more for Justin Fields than for Aaron Rodgers, who is still building his career . he summoned the quarterback to new jersey and fired him in a meeting that turned contentious . "i respected it," one player said, reflecting on how he felt at the time .

title: College football betting lines: Michigan heads to Oklahoma in ranked showdown
content: the Seminoles rose the highest in this week's AP Poll . Florida State beat Alabama as 13.5-point underdogs fall to no. 21 . only four conferences are represented in the poll, according to ESPN Research .

title: Survivor pool strategy: The top teams to take in NFL's Week 1
content: ESPN Eliminator Challenge is one of the easiest and most fun games to play this season . pick one team, and as long as they win (or tie), you advance to the next round . if they lose, you are out . the biggest favorites tend to win the most over the long run .

title: Updated SP+ rankings for all 136 FBS teams
content: in a single sentence, it's a tempo- and opponent-adjusted measure of college football efficiency . it does not automatically give credit for big wins or particularly brave scheduling . early in the season, ratings are based primarily on preseason projections .

title: Life on the WNBA fringe: Suitcases, sacrifice, soul-searching
content: haley Jones reserved a drawer for her gear for her Atlanta Dream gear . she cleared out two more drawers for two more teams . there's 3:42 to go in the game, and Dallas is down 76-74 with six seconds on the shot clock .

title: Why Dwight Howard absolutely belongs as a first-ballot Hall of Famer
content: dwight Howard will be enshrined in the Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame this weekend . as of 2021, Howard was one of 26 players in NBA history with at least five first-team All-NBA nods . the other 25 were named to the league's 75th Anniversary Team that year .
